memberdef.name: PRINT_BUF
memberdef.initializer: do { \ printf("%s[%lu] = ", #buf, (unsigned long)len); \ print_buf_plain(buf, len); \ } while(0)

memberdef.name: STATIC_ASSERT

detaileddescription.para: Assert statically that expr is true.
This is a statement-like macro and can only be used inside functions.

memberdef.name: ASSERT_INT_CONST_AND_DO

detaileddescription.para: Assert statically that expr is an integer constant expression, and run stmt.
Useful for example to enforce that magnitude arguments are constant.

memberdef.name: CHECK

detaileddescription.para: We use this to avoid possible compiler bugs with memcmp, e.g. https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=95189
If flag is true, set *r equal to *a; otherwise leave it. Constant-time. Both *r and *a must be initialized and non-negative.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint32_t x, const unsigned int by)
memberdef.name: secp256k1_rotr32
